{{Infobox person |name = Ali Ahusan Ihusan |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1986|6|03}} |birth_place = [[Male']], [[Maldives]] |occupation = News Editor(Dhiislam Daily) |spouse = Aishath Shahula (2007 - present) |years_active = 2008 - present }}
'''Ali ahusan Ihusan''' (born June 3, 1986, [[Male', Maldives]]) is a [[Maldivian]] [[Journalist]], a web designer and the owner of Dhiislam Megazine and Dhiislam Online news.
He is well known for creating a promotional website of the mass protest held on December 23, 2011. Due to the creation of the website he was arrested for 24 hours. Police later said that they wanted to clarify who instructed him to develop the website and who published the information on it. On the following day hackers infiltrated the website and threatened the organizers of the protest by putting a message on its homepage saying, "we'll come out against you with machetes if you protest."
In 2009 he created an online blog called Dhiislam and later it became a registered online news website for Islamic news as well as local and international news. In 2011 he started a print magazine in the name of Dhiislam.
He is married to Aishath Shahula since September 3, 2007 and they have currently live in [[Male']], [[Maldives]].
==References== {{}}
==External links== *http://dhiislam.com

{{db-person}} {{Infobox person |name = Ali Ahusan Ihusan |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1986|6|03}} |birth_place = [[Male']], [[Maldives]] |occupation = News Editor(Dhiislam Daily) |spouse = Aishath Shahula (2007 - present) |years_active = 2008 - present }}
'''Ali Ahusan Ihusan''' (born June 3, 1986, [[Male']] , [[Maldives]]) is a [[Maldivian]] [[Journalist]], a web designer and the owner of Dhiislam Megazine and Dhiislam Online news.
He is well known for creating a promotional website for the mass protest held on December 23 2011 in Maldives. Due to the creation of the website he was arrested for 24 hours. Police later said that they wanted to clarify who instructed him to develop the website and who published the information on it. On the following day hackers infiltrated the website and threatened the organizers of the protest by putting a message on its homepage saying, "we'll come out against you with machetes if you protest."<ref>http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39233</ref>
[[File:Ali_Ahusun_taking_to_court_December_2011.jpg|thumb|center|alt=Ahusn in Court.|Ali Ahusun is being taken to court on December_2011.]]
In 2009 he created an online blog called Dhiislam and later it became a registered online news website for Islamic news as well as local and international news.<ref>http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/102142</ref> In 2011 he started a print magazine in the name of Dhiislam. And also he is responsible for publishing the weekly Islamic magazine (Hidhaayathuge Ali) funded by Ministry of Islamic Affaires, Maldives.<ref>http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/126389</ref>
He is married to Aishath Shahula since September 3, 2007 and they have currently live in [[Male']], [[Maldives]].

{{Infobox person |name = Ali Ahusan Ihusan | image= Ali_Ahusun_taking_to_court_December_2011.jpg | image_size = 160 | caption= Ali Ahusun is being taken to court on December 2011. |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1986|6|03}}<ref>http://www.facebook.com/alahusan/info</ref> |birth_place = [[Male']], [[Maldives]] |occupation = News Editor(Dhiislam Daily) |spouse = Aishath Shahula (2007 - present)<ref>http://www.facebook.com/alahusan/info</ref> |years_active = 2008 - present }} '''Ali Ahusan Ihusan''' (born June 3, 1986, [[Male']] , [[Maldives]]) is a [[Maldivian]] [[Journalist]], a web designer and the owner of Dhiislam Megazine and Dhiislam Online news.
Ali Ahusan Ihusan is known for creating a promotional website for the mass protest held on 23 December 2011 in Maldives. This mass protest played an important role in overthrowing the President Mohamed Nasheed's Government on the 7th February 2011.<ref>BBC. (7th Feb, 2011). Maldives President Mohamed Nasheed resigns amid unrest. Retrieved from http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-16922570</ref><ref>Minivan News. (2011). Protests proceed peacefully as a majority defends Islam. Retrieved from http://minivannews.com/politics/protests-proceed-peacefully-as-a-majority-defends-islam-29826</ref><ref>Ahmed, F. (14th December, 2011). Police summon protest website developer. Retrieved from http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39233</ref><ref>Haveeru Daily. (23rd December, 2011). LIVE: Maldivians gather in Male for 'religious' protests. Retrieved from http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39352</ref> Due to the creation of the website he was arrested for 24 hours. Police later said that they wanted to clarify who instructed him to develop the website and who published the information on it. On the following day hackers infiltrated the website and threatened the organizers of the protest by putting a message on its homepage saying, "we'll come out against you with machetes if you protest."<ref>Haveeru Daily. (23rd December, 2011). LIVE: Maldivians gather in Male for 'religious' protests. Retrieved from http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39352</ref>
In 2009 he created an online blog called Dhiislam and later it became a registered online news website for Islamic news as well as local and international news.<ref>Naseer,I. (7th April, 2011). Dhiislam got registered as a online News. Retrieved from http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/102142</ref> In 2011 he started a print magazine in the name of Dhiislam. And also he is responsible for publishing the weekly Islamic magazine (Hidhaayathuge Ali) funded by Ministry of Islamic Affairs, Maldives.<ref>Risan, A. (29th August, 2012). The Islam Ministry has handed over the rights of publishing Islamic weekly magazine to Dhiislam. Retrieved from http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/126389</ref>
He is married to Aishath Shahula since September 3, 2007 and they currently live in [[Male']], [[Maldives]].<ref>http://www.facebook.com/alahusan/info</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *http://dhiislam.com

revision.comment: A more balanced eloboration is added to the description of the person including views of those who are critical of this personality.
revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=October 2013}} {{Orphan|date=February 2013}}
{{Infobox person |name = Ali Ahusan Ihusan | image= | image_size = 160 | caption= Ali Ahusun is being taken to court on December 2011. |birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1986|6|03}}<ref>https://www.facebook.com/alahusan/info</ref> |birth_place = [[Male']], [[Maldives]] |occupation = Islamist News Editor (Dhiislam Daily) |years_active = 2008 - present |spouse = Aishath Shahula (2007 - present) (unknown) (2011 - present)<ref>https://www.facebook.com/alahusan/info</ref> }} '''Ali Ahusan Ihusan''' (born 3 June 1986, [[Male']], [[Maldives]]) is a controversial [[Maldives|Maldivian]] [[Journalist]], a self-employed web designer and the owner of Islamic fundamentalist publications; Dhiislam Magazine and Dhiislam Online news.
Ali Ahusan Ihusan is considered by many as one of the many Islamic extremist elements who facilitated the coup of 7 February 2011.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.dhivehisitee.com/parliament/islamic-extremism-maldives-alive-killing/|title = Islamic extremism in the Maldives: alive and killing - Dhivehi Sitee|date = 2012-10-19|website = Dhivehi Sitee|language = en-US|access-date = 2016-05-05}}</ref> He is also known for creating one of the promotional websites for the mass protest held on 23 December 2011 in Maldives which was supported by many Islamist of the Maldives. This mass protest played an important role in overthrowing the President [[Mohamed Nasheed]]'s Government on 7 February 2011.<ref>BBC. (7 Feb 2011). Maldives President [[Mohamed Nasheed]] resigns amid unrest. Retrieved from http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-16922570</ref><ref>Minivan News. (2011). Protests proceed peacefully as a majority defends [[Islam]]. Retrieved from http://minivannews.com/politics/protests-proceed-peacefully-as-a-majority-defends-islam-29826</ref><ref>Ahmed, F. (14 December 2011). Police summon protest website developer. Retrieved from http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39233</ref><ref>Haveeru Daily. (23 December 2011). LIVE: Maldivians gather in Male for 'religious' protests. Retrieved from http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39352</ref> He was arrested for 24 hours by Maldives Police Services after the publication of the website which openly issued death threats to anyone who is against to the doctrine of Islam he followed.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://english.sun.mv/675|title = Criminal Court orders release of Ahsan and custody of Hilath|website = Sun Online|access-date = 2016-05-05}}</ref> However, his lawyer, Mohamed Shaheem Ali Saeed, a Maldivian Islamic scholar infamous for his illicit relations with certain women facilitated his release.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://english.sun.mv/675|title = Criminal Court orders release of Ahsan and custody of Hilath|website = Sun Online|access-date = 2016-05-05}}</ref> Police later said that they wanted to clarify who instructed him to develop the website and who published the information on it. On the following day Ali Ahusan modified the page himself by putting a message on its homepage saying, "we'll come out against you with machetes if you protest." . <ref>Haveeru Daily. (23 December 2011). LIVE: Maldivians gather in [[Male']] for 'religious' protests. Retrieved from http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39352</ref> However he was neither arrested or questioned regarding this.
In 2009 he created an Islamic fundamentalist online blog called [[Dhiislam]] and later it became a registered online news website for [[Islamic]] news <ref>Naseer,I. (7 April 2011). [[Dhiislam]] got registered as a online News. Retrieved from http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/102142</ref> In 2011 he started to print magazine spreading fundamentalist beliefs by the name of Dhiislam. Moreover he is responsible for publishing the weekly Islamist magazine ([[Hidhaayathuge Ali]]) for which he received funding during the term of his lawyer, Mohamed Shaheem Ali Saeed, as the minister of Islamic Affairs.<ref>Risan, A. (29 August 2012). The Islam Ministry has handed over the rights of publishing Islamic weekly magazine to Dhiislam. Retrieved from http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/126389</ref>
It has been roumoured that he is married to several women and has captive slaves in African countries. However he is formally married to Aishath Shahula since 3 September 2007 and they currently live in [[Male']], [[Maldives]].<ref>https://www.facebook.com/alahusan/info</ref>

On the following day after Ali Ahusan's release, Ali Ahusan modified the page himself by putting a message on its homepage saying, "we'll come out against you with machetes if you protest." .<ref>Haveeru Daily. (23 December 2011). LIVE: Maldivians gather in [[Male']] for 'religious' protests. In 2009 he created an Islamic fundamentalist online blog called [[Dhiislam]] and it later became a registered online news website for [[Islamic]] news <ref>Naseer,I. (7 April 2011). [[Dhiislam]] got registered as a online News. Retrieved from http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/102142</ref> In 2011 he started to print a magazine spreading fundamentalist and extremist doctrine of Islam by the name of Dhiislam. It has been rumored that he is married to several women and has slaves for sexual sexual relations in African countries. However he is formally married to a Maldivian woman by the name of Aishath Shahula since 3 September 2007 and her current location is unknown.<ref>https://www.facebook.com/alahusan/info</ref>

revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=October 2013}} {{Orphan|date=February 2013}}
{{Infobox person |name = Ali Ahusan Ihusan | image= | image_size = 160 | caption= Ali Ahusun is being taken to court on December 2011. |birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1986|6|03}}<ref>https://www.facebook.com/alahusan/info</ref> |birth_place = [[Male']], [[Maldives]] |occupation = News Editor(Dhiislam Daily) |spouse = Aishath Shahula (2007 - present)<ref>https://www.facebook.com/alahusan/info</ref> |years_active = 2008 - present }} '''Ali Ahusan Ihusan''' (born 3 June 1986, [[Male']], [[Maldives]]) is a [[Maldives|Maldivian]] [[Journalist]], a web designer and the owner of Dhiislam Megazine and Dhiislam Online news.
Ali Ahusan Ihusan is known for creating a promotional website for the mass protest held on 23 December 2011 in Maldives. This mass protest played an important role in overthrowing the President [[Mohamed Nasheed]]'s Government on 7 February 2011.<ref>BBC. (7 Feb 2011). Maldives President [[Mohamed Nasheed]] resigns amid unrest. Retrieved from http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-16922570</ref><ref>Minivan News. (2011). Protests proceed peacefully as a majority defends [[Islam]]. Retrieved from http://minivannews.com/politics/protests-proceed-peacefully-as-a-majority-defends-islam-29826</ref><ref>Ahmed, F. (14 December 2011). Police summon protest website developer. Retrieved from http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39233</ref><ref>Haveeru Daily. (23 December 2011). LIVE: Maldivians gather in Male for 'religious' protests. Retrieved from http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39352</ref> Due to the creation of the website he was arrested for 24 hours. Police later said that they wanted to clarify who instructed him to develop the website and who published the information on it. On the following day hackers infiltrated the website and threatened the organizers of the protest by putting a message on its homepage saying, "we'll come out against you with machetes if you protest."<ref>Haveeru Daily. (23 December 2011). LIVE: Maldivians gather in [[Male']] for 'religious' protests. Retrieved from http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39352</ref>
In 2009 he created an online blog called [[Dhiislam]] and later it became a registered online news website for [[Islamic]] news as well as local and international news.<ref>Naseer,I. (7 April 2011). [[Dhiislam]] got registered as a online News. Retrieved from http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/102142</ref> In 2011 he started a print magazine in the name of Dhiislam. And also he is responsible for publishing the weekly Islamic magazine ([[Hidhaayathuge Ali]]) funded by Ministry of Islamic Affairs, Maldives.<ref>Risan, A. (29 August 2012). The Islam Ministry has handed over the rights of publishing Islamic weekly magazine to Dhiislam. Retrieved from http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/126389</ref>
He is married to Aishath Shahula since 3 September 2007 and they currently live in [[Male']], [[Maldives]].<ref>https://www.facebook.com/alahusan/info</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *http://dhiislam.com * http://ahusan.com/

{{Infobox person |name = Ali Ahusan Ihusan | image= | image_size = 160 | caption= Ali Ahusun is being taken to court on December 2011. |birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1986|6|03}}<ref>https://www.facebook.com/alahusan/info</ref> |birth_place = [[Male']], [[Maldives]] |occupation = Islamist News Editor (Dhiislam Daily) |years_active = 2008 - present |spouse = Aishath Shahula (2007 - present) (unknown) (2011 - present)<ref>https://www.facebook.com/alahusan/info</ref> }} '''Ali Ahusan Ihusan''' (born 3 June 1986, [[Male']], [[Maldives]]) is a controversial [[Maldives|Maldivian]] [[Journalist]], a self-employed web designer and the owner of Islamic fundamentalist publications; Dhiislam Magazine and Dhiislam Online news.
Ali Ahusan Ihusan is considered by many as one of the many Islamic extremist elements who facilitated the coup of 7 February 2011 in the Maldives.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.dhivehisitee.com/parliament/islamic-extremism-maldives-alive-killing/|title = Islamic extremism in the Maldives: alive and killing - Dhivehi Sitee|date = 2012-10-19|website = Dhivehi Sitee|language = en-US|access-date = 2016-05-05}}</ref> He is also known for creating one of the promotional websites supporting the mass protest held on 23 December 2011 in Maldives which was supported by many Islamists of the Maldives. This mass protest played an important role in overthrowing President [[Mohamed Nasheed]]'s Government on 7 February 2011.<ref>BBC. (7 Feb 2011). Maldives President [[Mohamed Nasheed]] resigns amid unrest. Retrieved from http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-16922570</ref><ref>Minivan News. (2011). Protests proceed peacefully as a majority defends [[Islam]]. Retrieved from http://minivannews.com/politics/protests-proceed-peacefully-as-a-majority-defends-islam-29826</ref><ref>Ahmed, F. (14 December 2011). Police summon protest website developer. Retrieved from http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39233</ref><ref>Haveeru Daily. (23 December 2011). LIVE: Maldivians gather in Male for 'religious' protests. Retrieved from http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39352</ref> He was arrested for 24 hours by [[Maldives Police Service]] after the publication of the website which openly issued death threats to anyone who is against the doctrine of Islam ([[Islamic fundamentalism|Islamic Fundamentalism]]) he followed.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://english.sun.mv/675|title = Criminal Court orders release of Ahsan and custody of Hilath|website = Sun Online|access-date = 2016-05-05}}</ref> However, his lawyer, Mohamed Shaheem Ali Saeed, a Maldivian Islamic scholar infamous for his illicit relations with women<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://minivannewsarchive.com/politics/raajje-tv-runs-footage-of-sheikh-shaheem-and-alleges-sex-scandal-30504|title=Raajje TV runs footage of Sheikh Shaheem and alleges sex scandal {{!}} Minivan News ‚Äì Archive|website=minivannewsarchive.com|access-date=2016-05-06}}</ref> facilitated his release.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://english.sun.mv/675|title = Criminal Court orders release of Ahsan and custody of Hilath|website = Sun Online|access-date = 2016-05-05}}</ref> Maldives Police Service later stated that they wanted to clarify as to who instructed him to develop the website and as to who published the information on it. On the following day after Ali Ahusan's release, Ali Ahusan modified the page himself by putting a message on its homepage saying, "we'll come out against you with machetes if you protest." .<ref>Haveeru Daily. (23 December 2011). LIVE: Maldivians gather in [[Male']] for 'religious' protests. Retrieved from http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39352</ref> However he was neither arrested or questioned regarding this.
In 2009 he created an Islamic fundamentalist online blog called [[Dhiislam]] and it later became a registered online news website for [[Islamic]] news <ref>Naseer,I. (7 April 2011). [[Dhiislam]] got registered as a online News. Retrieved from http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/102142</ref> In 2011 he started to print a magazine spreading fundamentalist and extremist doctrine of Islam by the name of Dhiislam. Moreover he is responsible for publishing the weekly Islamist magazine ([[Hidhaayathuge Ali]]) for which he received funding during the term of his lawyer, Mohamed Shaheem Ali Saeed, as the minister of Islamic Affairs.<ref>Risan, A. (29 August 2012). The Islam Ministry has handed over the rights of publishing Islamic weekly magazine to Dhiislam. Retrieved from http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/126389</ref>
He is formally married to a Maldivian woman by the name of Aishath Shahula since 3 September 2007 and her current location is unknown.<ref>https://www.facebook.com/alahusan/info</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *http://dhiislam.com * http://ahusan.com/

{{Infobox person |name = Ali Ahusan Ihusan | image= | image_size = 160 | caption= Ali Ahusun is being taken to court on December 2011. |birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1986|6|03}}<ref>https://www.facebook.com/alahusan/info</ref> |birth_place = [[Male']], [[Maldives]] |occupation = Islamist News Editor (Dhiislam Daily) |years_active = 2008 - present |spouse = Aishath Shahula (2007 - present) (unknown) (2011 - present)<ref>https://www.facebook.com/alahusan/info</ref> }} '''Ali Ahusan Ihusan''' (born 3 June 1986, [[Male']], [[Maldives]]) is a controversial [[Maldives|Maldivian]] [[Journalist]], a self-employed web designer and the owner of Islamic fundamentalist publications; Dhiislam Magazine and Dhiislam Online news.
Ali Ahusan Ihusan is considered by many as one of the many Islamic extremist elements who facilitated the coup of 7 February 2011 in the Maldives.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.dhivehisitee.com/parliament/islamic-extremism-maldives-alive-killing/|title = Islamic extremism in the Maldives: alive and killing - Dhivehi Sitee|date = 2012-10-19|website = Dhivehi Sitee|language = en-US|access-date = 2016-05-05}}</ref> He is also known for creating one of the promotional websites supporting the mass protest held on 23 December 2011 in Maldives which was supported by many Islamists of the Maldives. This mass protest played an important role in overthrowing President [[Mohamed Nasheed]]'s Government on 7 February 2011.<ref>BBC. (7 Feb 2011). Maldives President [[Mohamed Nasheed]] resigns amid unrest. Retrieved from http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-16922570</ref><ref>Minivan News. (2011). Protests proceed peacefully as a majority defends [[Islam]]. Retrieved from http://minivannews.com/politics/protests-proceed-peacefully-as-a-majority-defends-islam-29826</ref><ref>Ahmed, F. (14 December 2011). Police summon protest website developer. Retrieved from http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39233</ref><ref>Haveeru Daily. (23 December 2011). LIVE: Maldivians gather in Male for 'religious' protests. Retrieved from http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39352</ref> He was arrested for 24 hours by [[Maldives Police Service]] after the publication of the website which openly issued death threats to anyone who is against the doctrine of Islam ([[Islamic fundamentalism|Islamic Fundamentalism]]) he followed.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://english.sun.mv/675|title = Criminal Court orders release of Ahsan and custody of Hilath|website = Sun Online|access-date = 2016-05-05}}</ref> However, his lawyer, Mohamed Shaheem Ali Saeed, a Maldivian Islamic scholar infamous for his illicit relations with women<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://minivannewsarchive.com/politics/raajje-tv-runs-footage-of-sheikh-shaheem-and-alleges-sex-scandal-30504|title=Raajje TV runs footage of Sheikh Shaheem and alleges sex scandal {{!}} Minivan News ‚Äì Archive|website=minivannewsarchive.com|access-date=2016-05-06}}</ref> facilitated his release.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://english.sun.mv/675|title = Criminal Court orders release of Ahsan and custody of Hilath|website = Sun Online|access-date = 2016-05-05}}</ref> Maldives Police Service later stated that they wanted to clarify as to who instructed him to develop the website and as to who published the information on it. On the following day after Ali Ahusan's release, Ali Ahusan modified the page himself by putting a message on its homepage saying, "we'll come out against you with machetes if you protest." .<ref>Haveeru Daily. (23 December 2011). LIVE: Maldivians gather in [[Male']] for 'religious' protests. Retrieved from http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39352</ref> However he was neither arrested or questioned regarding this.
In 2009 he created an Islamic fundamentalist online blog called [[Dhiislam]] and it later became a registered online news website for [[Islamic]] news <ref>Naseer,I. (7 April 2011). [[Dhiislam]] got registered as a online News. Retrieved from http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/102142</ref> In 2011 he started to print a magazine spreading fundamentalist and extremist doctrine of Islam by the name of Dhiislam. Moreover, he is responsible for publishing the weekly Islamist magazine ([[Hidhaayathuge Ali]]) for which he received funding during the term of his lawyer, Mohamed Shaheem Ali Saeed, as the minister of Islamic Affairs.<ref>Risan, A. (29 August 2012). The Islam Ministry has handed over the rights of publishing Islamic weekly magazine to Dhiislam. Retrieved from http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/126389</ref>
He is formally married to a Maldivian woman by the name of Aishath Shahula since 3 September 2007 and her current location is unknown.<ref>https://www.facebook.com/alahusan/info</ref>

{{Infobox person |name = Ali Ahusan Ihusan | image= | image_size = 160 | caption= Ali Ahusun is being taken to court on December 2011. |birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1986|6|03}}<ref>https://www.facebook.com/alahusan/info</ref> |birth_place = [[Male']], [[Maldives]] |occupation = Islamist News Editor (Dhiislam Daily) |years_active = 2008 - present |spouse = Aishath Shahula (2007 - present) (unknown) (2011 - present)<ref>https://www.facebook.com/alahusan/info</ref> }} '''Ali Ahusan Ihusan''' (born 3 June 1986, [[Male']], [[Maldives]]) is a controversial [[Maldives|Maldivian]] [[Journalist]], a self-employed web designer and the owner of Islamic fundamentalist publications; Dhiislam Magazine and Dhiislam Online news.
Ali Ahusan Ihusan is considered by many as one of the many Islamic extremist elements who facilitated the coup of 7 February 2011 in the Maldives.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.dhivehisitee.com/parliament/islamic-extremism-maldives-alive-killing/|title = Islamic extremism in the Maldives: alive and killing - Dhivehi Sitee|date = 2012-10-19|website = Dhivehi Sitee|language = en-US|access-date = 2016-05-05}}</ref> He is also known for creating one of the promotional websites supporting the mass protest held on 23 December 2011 in Maldives which was supported by many Islamists of the Maldives. This mass protest played an important role in overthrowing President [[Mohamed Nasheed]]'s Government on 7 February 2011.<ref>{{cite news|work=[[BBC]]|date=7 February 2011|title= Maldives President Mohamed Nasheed resigns amid unrest|url= http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-16922570}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|work=[[Minivan News]]|year=2011|title= Protests proceed peacefully as a majority defends Islam]|url=http://minivannews.com/politics/protests-proceed-peacefully-as-a-majority-defends-islam-29826}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|work=[[Haveeru Daily]]|last=Ahmed|first= F. |date=14 December 2011|title= Police summon protest website developer|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39233}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|work=[[Haveeru Daily]]|date= 23 December 2011|title= LIVE: Maldivians gather in Male for 'religious' protests|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39352 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-03-29 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120111204729/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39352 |archivedate=11 January 2012 }}</ref> He was arrested for 24 hours by [[Maldives Police Service]] after the publication of the website which openly issued death threats to anyone who is against the doctrine of Islam ([[Islamic fundamentalism|Islamic Fundamentalism]]) he followed.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://english.sun.mv/675|title = Criminal Court orders release of Ahsan and custody of Hilath|website = Sun Online|access-date = 2016-05-05}}</ref> However, his lawyer, Mohamed Shaheem Ali Saeed, a Maldivian Islamic scholar infamous for his illicit relations with women<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://minivannewsarchive.com/politics/raajje-tv-runs-footage-of-sheikh-shaheem-and-alleges-sex-scandal-30504|title=Raajje TV runs footage of Sheikh Shaheem and alleges sex scandal {{!}} Minivan News ‚Äì Archive|website=minivannewsarchive.com|access-date=2016-05-06}}</ref> facilitated his release.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://english.sun.mv/675|title = Criminal Court orders release of Ahsan and custody of Hilath|website = Sun Online|access-date = 2016-05-05}}</ref> Maldives Police Service later stated that they wanted to clarify as to who instructed him to develop the website and as to who published the information on it. On the following day after Ali Ahusan's release, Ali Ahusan modified the page himself by putting a message on its homepage saying, "we'll come out against you with machetes if you protest."<ref>''[[Haveeru Daily]]'' 23 December 2011| LIVE: Maldivians gather in [[Male']] for 'religious' protests {{cite web|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39352 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-03-29 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120111204729/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39352 |archivedate=11 January 2012 }}</ref> However he was neither arrested or questioned regarding this.
In 2009 he created an Islamic fundamentalist online blog called [[Dhiislam]] and it later became a registered online news website for [[Islamic]] news <ref>{{cite news|last=Naseer |first=I. |date=7 April 2011|title= Dhiislam got registered as a online News|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/102142|work=[[Haveeru Daily]]}}</ref> In 2011 he started to print a magazine spreading fundamentalist and extremist doctrine of Islam by the name of Dhiislam. Moreover, he is responsible for publishing the weekly Islamist magazine ([[Hidhaayathuge Ali]]) for which he received funding during the term of his lawyer, Mohamed Shaheem Ali Saeed, as the minister of Islamic Affairs.<ref>{{cite news|last=Risan|first= A. |date=29 August 2012|title= The Islam Ministry has handed over the rights of publishing Islamic weekly magazine to Dhiislam|work=Haveery Daily|url= http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/126389}}</ref>
He is formally married to a Maldivian woman by the name of Aishath Shahula since 3 September 2007 and her current location is unknown.<ref>https://www.facebook.com/alahusan/info</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *[http://dhiislam.com dhiislam.com] *[http://ahusan.com/ ahusan.com]

([[Islamic fundamentalism|Islamic Fundamentalism]]) he followed.<ref name="auto">{{Cite web|url = http://english.sun.mv/675|title = Criminal Court orders release of Ahsan and custody of Hilath|website = Sun Online|access-date = 2016-05-05}}</ref> However, his lawyer, Mohamed Shaheem Ali Saeed, a Maldivian Islamic scholar infamous for his illicit relations with women<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://minivannewsarchive.com/politics/raajje-tv-runs-footage-of-sheikh-shaheem-and-alleges-sex-scandal-30504|title=Raajje TV runs footage of Sheikh Shaheem and alleges sex scandal {{!}} Minivan News ‚Äì Archive|website=minivannewsarchive.com|access-date=2016-05-06}}</ref> facilitated his release.<ref name="auto"/> Maldives Police Service later stated that they wanted to clarify as to who instructed him to develop the website and as to who published the information on it. On the following day after Ali Ahusan's release, Ali Ahusan modified the page himself by putting a message on its homepage saying, "we'll come out against you with machetes if you protest."<ref>''[[Haveeru Daily]]'' 23 December 2011| LIVE: Maldivians gather in [[Male']] for 'religious' protests {{cite web|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39352 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-03-29 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120111204729/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39352 |archivedate=11 January 2012 }}</ref> However he was neither arrested or questioned regarding this.
In 2009 he created an Islamic fundamentalist online [[blog]] called ''[[Dhiislam]]'' and it later became a registered online news website for [[Islamic]] news.<ref>{{cite news|last=Naseer|first=I.|date=7 April 2011|title=Dhiislam got registered as a online News|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/102142|work=[[Haveeru Daily]]|access-date=8 February 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131022211038/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/102142|archive-date=22 October 2013|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> In 2011 he started to print a magazine spreading fundamentalist and extremist doctrine of Islam by the name of Dhiislam. Moreover, he is responsible for publishing the weekly Islamist magazine ''[[Hidhaayathuge Ali]]'' for which he received funding during the term of his lawyer, [[Mohamed Shaheem Ali Saeed]], as the [[Ministry of Islamic Affairs (Maldives)|minister of Islamic Affairs]].<ref>{{cite news|last=Risan|first=A.|date=29 August 2012|title=The Islam Ministry has handed over the rights of publishing Islamic weekly magazine to Dhiislam|work=Haveery Daily|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/126389|access-date=8 February 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131022211030/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/126389|archive-date=22 October 2013|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
He is formally married to a Maldivian woman by the name of Aishath Shahula since 3 September 2007 and her current location is unknown.<ref name="facebook.com"/>
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *[http://dhiislam.com dhiislam.com] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20140421072930/http://ahusan.com/ ahusan.com]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Ihusan, Ali Ahusan}} [[Category:1986 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Mal√©]] [[Category:Maldivian journalists]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=October 2013}} {{Orphan|date=February 2013}}
{{Infobox person |name = Ali Ahusan Ihusan | image= | image_size = 160 | caption= Ali Ahusun is being taken to court on December 2011. |birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1986|6|03}}<ref name="facebook.com">https://www.facebook.com/alahusan/info</ref> |birth_place = [[Male']], [[Maldives]] |occupation = Islamist News Editor (Dhiislam Daily) |years_active = 2008 - present |spouse = Aishath Shahula (2007 - present) (unknown) (2011 - present)<ref name="facebook.com"/> }} '''Ali Ahusan Ihusan''' (born 3 June 1986, [[Male']], [[Maldives]]) is a controversial [[Maldives|Maldivian]] [[Journalist]], a self-employed web designer and the owner of [[Islamic fundamentalism|Islamic fundamentalist]] publications; ''Dhiislam Magazine'' and ''Dhiislam Online'' news.
Ali Ahusan Ihusan is considered by many as one of the many Islamic extremist elements who facilitated the coup of 7 February 2011 in the Maldives.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.dhivehisitee.com/parliament/islamic-extremism-maldives-alive-killing/|title = Islamic extremism in the Maldives: alive and killing - Dhivehi Sitee|date = 2012-10-19|website = Dhivehi Sitee|language = en-US|access-date = 2016-05-05}}</ref> He is also known for creating one of the promotional websites supporting the mass protest held on 23 December 2011 in Maldives which was supported by many Islamists of the Maldives. This mass protest played an important role in overthrowing President [[Mohamed Nasheed]]'s Government on 7 February 2011.<ref>{{cite news|work=[[BBC]]|date=7 February 2011|title= Maldives President Mohamed Nasheed resigns amid unrest|url= https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-16922570}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|work=[[Minivan News]]|year=2011|title=Protests proceed peacefully as a majority defends Islam]|url=http://minivannews.com/politics/protests-proceed-peacefully-as-a-majority-defends-islam-29826|access-date=8 February 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130128090357/http://minivannews.com/politics/protests-proceed-peacefully-as-a-majority-defends-islam-29826|archive-date=28 January 2013|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|work=[[Haveeru Daily]]|last=Ahmed|first=F.|date=14 December 2011|title=Police summon protest website developer|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39233|access-date=8 February 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131022211026/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39233|archive-date=22 October 2013|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|work=[[Haveeru Daily]]|date= 23 December 2011|title= LIVE: Maldivians gather in Male for 'religious' protests (archived copy)|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39352 |accessdate=2012-03-29 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120111204729/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39352 |archivedate=11 January 2012 }}</ref> He was arrested for 24 hours by [[Maldives Police Service]] after the publication of the website which openly issued death threats to anyone who is against the doctrine of Islam ([[Islamic fundamentalism|Islamic Fundamentalism]]) he followed.<ref name="auto">{{Cite web|url = http://english.sun.mv/675|title = Criminal Court orders release of Ahsan and custody of Hilath|website = Sun Online|access-date = 2016-05-05}}</ref> However, his lawyer, Mohamed Shaheem Ali Saeed, a Maldivian Islamic scholar infamous for his illicit relations with women<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://minivannewsarchive.com/politics/raajje-tv-runs-footage-of-sheikh-shaheem-and-alleges-sex-scandal-30504|title=Raajje TV runs footage of Sheikh Shaheem and alleges sex scandal {{!}} Minivan News ‚Äì Archive|website=minivannewsarchive.com|access-date=2016-05-06}}</ref> facilitated his release.<ref name="auto"/> Maldives Police Service later stated that they wanted to clarify as to who instructed him to develop the website and as to who published the information on it. On the following day after Ali Ahusan's release, Ali Ahusan modified the page himself by putting a message on its homepage saying, "we'll come out against you with machetes if you protest."<ref>''[[Haveeru Daily]]'' 23 December 2011| LIVE: Maldivians gather in [[Male']] for 'religious' protests {{cite web|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39352 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-03-29 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120111204729/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39352 |archivedate=11 January 2012 }}</ref> However he was neither arrested or questioned regarding this.
In 2009 he created an Islamic fundamentalist online [[blog]] called ''[[Dhiislam]]'' and it later became a registered online news website for [[Islamic]] news.<ref>{{cite news|last=Naseer|first=I.|date=7 April 2011|title=Dhiislam got registered as a online News|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/102142|work=[[Haveeru Daily]]|access-date=8 February 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131022211038/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/102142|archive-date=22 October 2013|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> In 2011 he started to print a magazine spreading fundamentalist and extremist doctrine of Islam by the name of Dhiislam. Moreover, he is responsible for publishing the weekly Islamist magazine ''[[Hidhaayathuge Ali]]'' for which he received funding during the term of his lawyer, [[Mohamed Shaheem Ali Saeed]], as the [[Ministry of Islamic Affairs (Maldives)|minister of Islamic Affairs]].<ref>{{cite news|last=Risan|first=A.|date=29 August 2012|title=The Islam Ministry has handed over the rights of publishing Islamic weekly magazine to Dhiislam|work=Haveery Daily|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/126389|access-date=8 February 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131022211030/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/126389|archive-date=22 October 2013|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
He is formally married to a Maldivian woman by the name of Aishath Shahula since 3 September 2007 and her current location is unknown.<ref name="facebook.com"/>
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *[http://dhiislam.com dhiislam.com] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20140421072930/http://ahusan.com/ ahusan.com]

{{Infobox person |name = Ali Ahusan Ihusan | image= | image_size = 160 | caption= Ali Ahusun is being taken to court on December 2011. |birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1986|6|03}}<ref name="facebook.com">https://www.facebook.com/alahusan/info</ref> |birth_place = [[Male']], [[Maldives]] |occupation = Islamist News Editor (Dhiislam Daily) |years_active = 2008 - present |spouse = Aishath Shahula (2007 - present) (unknown) (2011 - present)<ref name="facebook.com"/> }} '''Ali Ahusan Ihusan''' (born 3 June 1986, [[Male']], [[Maldives]]) is a controversial [[Maldives|Maldivian]] [[Journalist]], a self-employed web designer and the owner of [[Islamic fundamentalism|Islamic fundamentalist]] publications; ''Dhiislam Magazine'' and ''Dhiislam Online'' news.
Ali Ahusan Ihusan is considered by many as one of the many Islamic extremist elements who facilitated the coup of 7 February 2011 in the Maldives.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.dhivehisitee.com/parliament/islamic-extremism-maldives-alive-killing/|title = Islamic extremism in the Maldives: alive and killing - Dhivehi Sitee|date = 2012-10-19|website = Dhivehi Sitee|language = en-US|access-date = 2016-05-05}}</ref> He is also known for creating one of the promotional websites supporting the mass protest held on 23 December 2011 in Maldives which was supported by many Islamists of the Maldives. This mass protest played an important role in overthrowing President [[Mohamed Nasheed]]'s Government on 7 February 2011.<ref>{{cite news|work=[[BBC]]|date=7 February 2011|title= Maldives President Mohamed Nasheed resigns amid unrest|url= https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-16922570}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|work=[[Minivan News]]|year=2011|title=Protests proceed peacefully as a majority defends Islam]|url=http://minivannews.com/politics/protests-proceed-peacefully-as-a-majority-defends-islam-29826|access-date=8 February 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130128090357/http://minivannews.com/politics/protests-proceed-peacefully-as-a-majority-defends-islam-29826|archive-date=28 January 2013|url-status=dead|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|work=[[Haveeru Daily]]|last=Ahmed|first=F.|date=14 December 2011|title=Police summon protest website developer|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39233|access-date=8 February 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131022211026/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39233|archive-date=22 October 2013|url-status=dead|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|work=[[Haveeru Daily]]|date= 23 December 2011|title= LIVE: Maldivians gather in Male for 'religious' protests (archived copy)|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39352 |accessdate=2012-03-29 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120111204729/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39352 |archivedate=11 January 2012 }}</ref> He was arrested for 24 hours by [[Maldives Police Service]] after the publication of the website which openly issued death threats to anyone who is against the doctrine of Islam ([[Islamic fundamentalism|Islamic Fundamentalism]]) he followed.<ref name="auto">{{Cite web|url = http://english.sun.mv/675|title = Criminal Court orders release of Ahsan and custody of Hilath|website = Sun Online|access-date = 2016-05-05}}</ref> However, his lawyer, Mohamed Shaheem Ali Saeed, a Maldivian Islamic scholar infamous for his illicit relations with women<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://minivannewsarchive.com/politics/raajje-tv-runs-footage-of-sheikh-shaheem-and-alleges-sex-scandal-30504|title=Raajje TV runs footage of Sheikh Shaheem and alleges sex scandal {{!}} Minivan News ‚Äì Archive|website=minivannewsarchive.com|access-date=2016-05-06}}</ref> facilitated his release.<ref name="auto"/> Maldives Police Service later stated that they wanted to clarify as to who instructed him to develop the website and as to who published the information on it. On the following day after Ali Ahusan's release, Ali Ahusan modified the page himself by putting a message on its homepage saying, "we'll come out against you with machetes if you protest."<ref>''[[Haveeru Daily]]'' 23 December 2011| LIVE: Maldivians gather in [[Male']] for 'religious' protests {{cite web|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39352 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-03-29 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120111204729/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39352 |archivedate=11 January 2012 }}</ref> However he was neither arrested or questioned regarding this.
In 2009 he created an Islamic fundamentalist online [[blog]] called ''[[Dhiislam]]'' and it later became a registered online news website for [[Islamic]] news.<ref>{{cite news|last=Naseer|first=I.|date=7 April 2011|title=Dhiislam got registered as a online News|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/102142|work=[[Haveeru Daily]]|access-date=8 February 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131022211038/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/102142|archive-date=22 October 2013|url-status=dead|df=dmy-all}}</ref> In 2011 he started to print a magazine spreading fundamentalist and extremist doctrine of Islam by the name of Dhiislam. Moreover, he is responsible for publishing the weekly Islamist magazine ''[[Hidhaayathuge Ali]]'' for which he received funding during the term of his lawyer, [[Mohamed Shaheem Ali Saeed]], as the [[Ministry of Islamic Affairs (Maldives)|minister of Islamic Affairs]].<ref>{{cite news|last=Risan|first=A.|date=29 August 2012|title=The Islam Ministry has handed over the rights of publishing Islamic weekly magazine to Dhiislam|work=Haveery Daily|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/126389|access-date=8 February 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131022211030/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/126389|archive-date=22 October 2013|url-status=dead|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
He is formally married to a Maldivian woman by the name of Aishath Shahula since 3 September 2007 and her current location is unknown.<ref name="facebook.com"/>
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *[http://dhiislam.com dhiislam.com] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20140421072930/http://ahusan.com/ ahusan.com]

{{Infobox person |name = Ali Ahusan Ihusan | image= | image_size = 160 | caption= Ali Ahusun is being taken to court on December 2011. |birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1986|6|03}}<ref name="facebook.com">https://www.facebook.com/alahusan/info</ref> |birth_place = [[Male']], [[Maldives]] |occupation = Islamist News Editor (Dhiislam Daily) |years_active = 2008 - present |spouse = Aishath Shahula (2007 - present)<ref name="facebook.com"/> }} '''Ali Ahusan Ihusan''' (born 3 June 1986, [[Male']], [[Maldives]]) is a controversial [[Maldives|Maldivian]] [[Journalist]], a self-employed web designer and the owner of [[Islamic fundamentalism|Islamic fundamentalist]] publications; ''Dhiislam Magazine'' and ''Dhiislam Online'' news.
Ali Ahusan Ihusan is considered by many as one of the many Islamic extremist elements who facilitated the coup of 7 February 2011 in the Maldives.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.dhivehisitee.com/parliament/islamic-extremism-maldives-alive-killing/|title = Islamic extremism in the Maldives: alive and killing - Dhivehi Sitee|date = 2012-10-19|website = Dhivehi Sitee|language = en-US|access-date = 2016-05-05}}</ref> He is also known for creating one of the promotional websites supporting the mass protest held on 23 December 2011 in Maldives which was supported by many Islamists of the Maldives. This mass protest played an important role in overthrowing President [[Mohamed Nasheed]]'s Government on 7 February 2011.<ref>{{cite news|work=[[BBC]]|date=7 February 2011|title= Maldives President Mohamed Nasheed resigns amid unrest|url= https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-16922570}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|work=[[Minivan News]]|year=2011|title=Protests proceed peacefully as a majority defends Islam]|url=http://minivannews.com/politics/protests-proceed-peacefully-as-a-majority-defends-islam-29826|access-date=8 February 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130128090357/http://minivannews.com/politics/protests-proceed-peacefully-as-a-majority-defends-islam-29826|archive-date=28 January 2013|url-status=dead|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|work=[[Haveeru Daily]]|last=Ahmed|first=F.|date=14 December 2011|title=Police summon protest website developer|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39233|access-date=8 February 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131022211026/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39233|archive-date=22 October 2013|url-status=dead|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|work=[[Haveeru Daily]]|date= 23 December 2011|title= LIVE: Maldivians gather in Male for 'religious' protests (archived copy)|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39352 |accessdate=2012-03-29 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120111204729/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39352 |archivedate=11 January 2012 }}</ref> He was arrested for 24 hours by [[Maldives Police Service]] after the publication of the website which openly issued death threats to anyone who is against the doctrine of Islam ([[Islamic fundamentalism|Islamic Fundamentalism]]) he followed.<ref name="auto">{{Cite web|url = http://english.sun.mv/675|title = Criminal Court orders release of Ahsan and custody of Hilath|website = Sun Online|access-date = 2016-05-05}}</ref> However, his lawyer, Mohamed Shaheem Ali Saeed, a Maldivian Islamic scholar infamous for his illicit relations with women<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://minivannewsarchive.com/politics/raajje-tv-runs-footage-of-sheikh-shaheem-and-alleges-sex-scandal-30504|title=Raajje TV runs footage of Sheikh Shaheem and alleges sex scandal {{!}} Minivan News ‚Äì Archive|website=minivannewsarchive.com|access-date=2016-05-06}}</ref> facilitated his release.<ref name="auto"/> Maldives Police Service later stated that they wanted to clarify as to who instructed him to develop the website and as to who published the information on it. On the following day after Ali Ahusan's release, Ali Ahusan modified the page himself by putting a message on its homepage saying, "we'll come out against you with machetes if you protest."<ref>''[[Haveeru Daily]]'' 23 December 2011| LIVE: Maldivians gather in [[Male']] for 'religious' protests {{cite web|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39352 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-03-29 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120111204729/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39352 |archivedate=11 January 2012 }}</ref> However he was neither arrested or questioned regarding this.
In 2009 he created an Islamic fundamentalist online [[blog]] called ''[[Dhiislam]]'' and it later became a registered online news website for [[Islamic]] news.<ref>{{cite news|last=Naseer|first=I.|date=7 April 2011|title=Dhiislam got registered as an online News|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/102142|work=[[Haveeru Daily]]|access-date=8 February 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131022211038/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/102142|archive-date=22 October 2013|url-status=dead|df=dmy-all}}</ref> In 2011 he started to print a magazine spreading fundamentalist and extremist doctrine of Islam by the name of Dhiislam. Moreover, he is responsible for publishing the weekly Islamist magazine ''[[Hidhaayathuge Ali]]'' for which he received funding during the term of his lawyer, [[Mohamed Shaheem Ali Saeed]], as the [[Ministry of Islamic Affairs (Maldives)|minister of Islamic Affairs]].<ref>{{cite news|last=Risan|first=A.|date=29 August 2012|title=The Islam Ministry has handed over the rights of publishing Islamic weekly magazine to Dhiislam|work=Haveery Daily|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/126389|access-date=8 February 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131022211030/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/126389|archive-date=22 October 2013|url-status=dead|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
He is formally married to a Maldivian woman by the name of Aishath Shahula since 3 September 2007 and her current location is unknown.<ref name="facebook.com"/>

2013|url-status=dead|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|work=[[Haveeru Daily]]|date= 23 December 2011|title= LIVE: Maldivians gather in Male for 'religious' protests (archived copy)|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39352 |accessdate=2012-03-29 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120111204729/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39352 |archivedate=11 January 2012 }}</ref> He was arrested for 24 hours by [[Maldives Police Service]] after the publication of the website which openly issued death threats to anyone who is against the doctrine of Islam ([[Islamic fundamentalism|Islamic Fundamentalism]]) he followed.<ref name="auto">{{Cite web|url = http://english.sun.mv/675|title = Criminal Court orders release of Ahsan and custody of Hilath|website = Sun Online|access-date = 2016-05-05}}</ref> However, his lawyer, Mohamed Shaheem Ali Saeed, a Maldivian Islamic scholar infamous for his illicit relations with women<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://minivannewsarchive.com/politics/raajje-tv-runs-footage-of-sheikh-shaheem-and-alleges-sex-scandal-30504|title=Raajje TV runs footage of Sheikh Shaheem and alleges sex scandal {{!}} Minivan News ‚Äì Archive|website=minivannewsarchive.com|access-date=2016-05-06}}</ref> facilitated his release.<ref name="auto"/> Maldives Police Service later stated that they wanted to clarify as to who instructed him to develop the website and as to who published the information on it.
In 2009 he created an Islamic fundamentalist online [[blog]] called ''[[Dhiislam]]'' and it later became a registered online news website for [[Islamic]] news.<ref>{{cite news|last=Naseer|first=I.|date=7 April 2011|title=Dhiislam got registered as an online News|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/102142|work=[[Haveeru Daily]]|access-date=8 February 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131022211038/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/102142|archive-date=22 October 2013|url-status=dead|df=dmy-all}}</ref> In 2011 he started to print a magazine spreading fundamentalist and extremist doctrine of Islam by the name of Dhiislam. Moreover, he is responsible for publishing the weekly Islamist magazine ''[[Hidhaayathuge Ali]]'' for which he received funding during the term of his lawyer, [[Mohamed Shaheem Ali Saeed]], as the [[Ministry of Islamic Affairs (Maldives)|minister of Islamic Affairs]].<ref>{{cite news|last=Risan|first=A.|date=29 August 2012|title=The Islam Ministry has handed over the rights of publishing Islamic weekly magazine to Dhiislam|work=Haveery Daily|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/126389|access-date=8 February 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131022211030/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/126389|archive-date=22 October 2013|url-status=dead|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
He is formally married to a Maldivian woman by the name of Aishath Shahula since 3 September 2007 and her current location is unknown.<ref name="facebook.com"/>

Ali Ahusan Ihusan is considered by many as one of the many elements who facilitated the coup of 7 February 2011 in the Maldives.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.dhivehisitee.com/parliament/islamic-extremism-maldives-alive-killing/|title = Islamic extremism in the Maldives: alive and killing - Dhivehi Sitee|date = 2012-10-19|website = Dhivehi Sitee|language = en-US|access-date = 2016-05-05}}</ref> He is also known for creating one of the promotional websites supporting the mass protest held on 23 December 2011 in Maldives which was supported by many Islamists of the Maldives. {{Infobox person |name = Ali Ahusan Ihusan | image= | image_size = 160 | caption= Ali Ahusun is being taken to court on December 2011. |birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1986|6|03}}<ref name="facebook.com">https://www.facebook.com/alahusan/info {{User-generated source|certain=yes|date=March 2022}}</ref> |birth_place = [[Male']], [[Maldives]] |occupation = Islamist News Editor (Dhiislam Daily) |years_active = 2008 - present |spouse = Aishath Shahula (2007 - present)<ref name="facebook.com"/> }} '''Ali Ahusan Ihusan''' (born 3 June 1986, [[Male']], [[Maldives]]) is a [[Maldives|Maldivian]] [[Journalist]], a self-employed web designer and the owner of [[Islamic fundamentalism|Islamic]] publications; ''Dhiislam Magazine'' and ''Dhiislam Online'' news. He also was a member of Maldives Media Council from 2018 to 2020.[https://today.mv/354/]
Ali Ahusan Ihusan is considered by many as one of the many elements who facilitated the coup of 7 February 2011 in the Maldives.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.dhivehisitee.com/parliament/islamic-extremism-maldives-alive-killing/|title = Islamic extremism in the Maldives: alive and killing - Dhivehi Sitee|date = 2012-10-19|website = Dhivehi Sitee|language = en-US|access-date = 2016-05-05}}</ref> He is also known for creating one of the promotional websites supporting the mass protest held on 23 December 2011 in Maldives which was supported by many Islamists of the Maldives. This mass protest played an important role in overthrowing President [[Mohamed Nasheed]]'s Government on 7 February 2011.<ref>{{cite news|work=[[BBC]]|date=7 February 2011|title= Maldives President Mohamed Nasheed resigns amid unrest|url= https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-16922570}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|work=[[Minivan News]]|year=2011|title=Protests proceed peacefully as a majority defends Islam]|url=http://minivannews.com/politics/protests-proceed-peacefully-as-a-majority-defends-islam-29826|access-date=8 February 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130128090357/http://minivannews.com/politics/protests-proceed-peacefully-as-a-majority-defends-islam-29826|archive-date=28 January 2013|url-status=dead|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|work=[[Haveeru Daily]]|last=Ahmed|first=F.|date=14 December 2011|title=Police summon protest website developer|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39233|access-date=8 February 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131022211026/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39233|archive-date=22 October 2013|url-status=dead|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|work=[[Haveeru Daily]]|date= 23 December 2011|title= LIVE: Maldivians gather in Male for 'religious' protests (archived copy)|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39352 |accessdate=2012-03-29 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120111204729/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/39352 |archivedate=11 January 2012 }}</ref> He was arrested for 24 hours by [[Maldives Police Service]] after the publication of the website which openly issued death threats to anyone who is against the doctrine of Islam ([[Islamic fundamentalism|Islamic Fundamentalism]]) he followed.<ref name="auto">{{Cite web|url = http://english.sun.mv/675|title = Criminal Court orders release of Ahsan and custody of Hilath|website = Sun Online|access-date = 2016-05-05}}</ref> However, his lawyer, Mohamed Shaheem Ali Saeed, a Maldivian Islamic scholar facilitated his release.<ref name="auto"/> Maldives Police Service later stated that they wanted to clarify as to who instructed him to develop the website and as to who published the information on it.
In 2009 he created an Islamic fundamentalist online [[blog]] called ''[[Dhiislam]]'' and it later became a registered online news website for [[Islamic]] news.<ref>{{cite news|last=Naseer|first=I.|date=7 April 2011|title=Dhiislam got registered as an online News|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/102142|work=[[Haveeru Daily]]|access-date=8 February 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131022211038/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/102142|archive-date=22 October 2013|url-status=dead|df=dmy-all}}</ref> In 2011 he started to print a magazine spreading fundamentalist and extremist doctrine of Islam by the name of Dhiislam. Moreover, he is responsible for publishing the weekly Islamist magazine ''[[Hidhaayathuge Ali]]'' for which he received funding during the term of his lawyer, [[Mohamed Shaheem Ali Saeed]], as the [[Ministry of Islamic Affairs (Maldives)|minister of Islamic Affairs]].<ref>{{cite news|last=Risan|first=A.|date=29 August 2012|title=The Islam Ministry has handed over the rights of publishing Islamic weekly magazine to Dhiislam|work=Haveery Daily|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/126389|access-date=8 February 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131022211030/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/126389|archive-date=22 October 2013|url-status=dead|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
<ref name="facebook.com"/>
